mainTitle: The City of a Thousand Minarets
frontPageDescription: Photo mapping the largest city of Africa and the Middle East
intro: Cairo also known as al-Qahira (The Victorious) is a city that never sleeps. It's not only Egypt's largest city but its most historic. The area is known for its landmarks that represent both Ancient Egypt and its Islamic history, drawing many tourists. Many of the region's most famous landmarks are not actually in Cairo but in the small neighboring city of Giza.
author: Karim Osman

keys.title: Ring Road
keys.description: The 72 kilometer long Cairo Ring Road is the most important freeway of the Greater Cairo metropolitan area in Egypt. The ring road encircles large parts of the cities of Cairo and Giza including Cairo International Airport. Construction began in the late 1980s

keys.title: View over Mirage City
keys.description: JW Marriott hotel is one of the many luxurious hotels for those that want to escape the crowded city life.

keys.title: El Teseen Street
keys.description: One of the main streets of New Cairo, a suburb on the southeastern edge of Cairo Governorate.
